newsitem.title: CHILE: Codelco board approves Salvador acid plant.
newsitem.headline: Codelco board approves Salvador acid plant.

text.p: The board of Chile's state copper company Codelco approved a $98 million investment in a new sulphuric acid plant at its Salvador division, said a spokeswoman Thursday.
Building work on the plant will begin in the next few weeks after the go-ahead given at a board meeting Wednesday, she said.
The board did not make an decision on how to proceed developing the San Antonio copper deposit, she said.
"Nothing happened with San Antonio. Discussion has been postponed until the next board meeting at the end of July," she said.
San Antonio, which lies near the Salvador pit, is believed to have sufficent reserves to produce around 100,000 tonnes a year of fine copper.

Codelco officials have said they would be interested in involving local investors, including private pension funds, in financing the project. ((-- Margaret Orgill, Santiago newsroom, 562-699-5595x212))
